meanings.definition: relating to or suffering from amblyopia
meanings.sent1: The amblyopic patient had trouble seeing clearly out of one eye.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the amblyopic condition in the young child's eye.
meanings.sent3: The amblyopic glasses made the patient look like a superhero with special vision powers.
meanings.sent4: Her amblyopic view of the world painted everything in soft, blurry hues.
meanings.sent5: The amblyopic vision was like looking through a foggy window, distorting reality.

meanings.definition: having reduced vision in one eye due to abnormal development during childhood
meanings.sent1: An amblyopic eye may not see as clearly as the other eye.
meanings.sent2: The amblyopic child wore a patch to help improve vision in the weaker eye.
meanings.sent3: The amblyopic eye played hide-and-seek with the other eye, always a step behind.
meanings.sent4: Her amblyopic gaze seemed to miss the details that others easily noticed.
meanings.sent5: The amblyopic eye was like a sleepy sentinel, guarding the blurry gate of sight.
